steps.title: In a large pan, mix 1 lb of alum with 1 US-pint (470 ml) hot water from a faucet.
steps.content: In a large pan, mix 1 lb of alum with 1 US-pint (470 ml) hot water from a faucet. A preserving pan is a good size for this, to allow room for the fabric. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select the fabric that you wish to treat.
steps.content: Select the fabric that you wish to treat. Dip it into the pan and wet it completely.

steps.title: Pull out the completely wet fabric.
steps.content: Pull out the completely wet fabric. Put into a non-drip plastic basket to take outside. Hang on a line, over the basket, or over a clothes rack.

steps.title: Use once dried.
steps.content: Use once dried. Expect some stiffness compared to the original fabric but it should mold to the shape needed with bending.

steps.title: In a large pan, mix 1 cup ammonium chloride with 2 pints of water.
steps.content: In a large pan, mix 1 cup ammonium chloride with 2 pints of water.

steps.title: Add 1/2 cup ammonium phosphate and mix together.
steps.content: Add 1/2 cup ammonium phosphate and mix together.

steps.title: Dip the fabric into the pan and completely cover as above.
steps.content: Dip the fabric into the pan and completely cover as above. Dry as above.

steps.title: Mix 6 parts/lbs borax, 5 parts/lbs boric acid, 100 parts/12 gallons (45.4 L) water in a large container.
steps.content: Mix 6 parts/lbs borax, 5 parts/lbs boric acid, 100 parts/12 gallons (45.4 L) water in a large container. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dip the fabric in until completely soaked.
steps.content: Dip the fabric in until completely soaked. Repeat if needed. Allow to dry. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Mix 7 parts/7lbs borax, 3 parts/3 lbs boric acid, 100 parts/12 gallons (45.4 L) water in a large container.
steps.content: Mix 7 parts/7lbs borax, 3 parts/3 lbs boric acid, 100 parts/12 gallons (45.4 L) water in a large container. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Follow above steps.
steps.content: Follow above steps. For rayon and sheer fabrics, 17 gallons (64.4 L) of water are recommended.

steps.title: Mix 1 oz water glass (sodium silicate) with 9 oz water.
steps.content: Mix 1 oz water glass (sodium silicate) with 9 oz water. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Wash fabric well and rinse completely before dipping in the silicate formula.
steps.content: Wash fabric well and rinse completely before dipping in the silicate formula.

steps.title: Leave to soak and hang to dry.
steps.content: Leave to soak and hang to dry.

steps.title: Mix 9 oz borax powder, 4 oz boric acid, with 1 gallon (3.8 L) water.
steps.content: Mix 9 oz borax powder, 4 oz boric acid, with 1 gallon (3.8 L) water. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Dip fabric or spray on.
steps.content: Dip fabric or spray on. Drip dry.
